title: Adapting Farming Practices To The Regional Environment | Resilient Farms in Germany

tasks.task: Starting and operating a dairy goat farm
subtasks: Explaining the history and origin of the farm
Introducing the types of goats raised (Thuringian dairy goats)
Describing the transition from another profession to becoming a farmer
Discussing milk production and processing (milking, cheese making)
Mentioning the variety of cheese produced and the cheese-making process
Highlighting the farm's energy efficiency measures (solar power, electric tractor)
Explaining the importance of local production and regional agriculture
Discussing the niche market for artisanal goat cheese and customer appeal
Producing different types of cheese (fresh, semi-soft, semi-hard, hard)
Cutting and shaping cheese using manual tools
Aging cheese and monitoring its texture and quality
Marketing and selling cheese directly to customers
Using natural herbs for decoration and appeal
Feeding goats with hay instead of silage
Treating and caring for milking goats
Ensuring hygiene and health in the milking parlor
Housing goats in a spacious barn with an outdoor exercise area
Regulating cheese curds during production
Maintaining energy efficiency in the cheese dairy operations
